snippet: China says it has instructed its airlines not to comply with European Union rules requiring carriers to pay to offset their emissions.
abstract: China says it has instructed its airlines not to comply with European Union rules requiring carriers to pay to offset their emissions.
lead_paragraph: China says it is barring its airlines from participating in a European Union system requiring carriers to pay for their carbon dioxide emissions when flying in or out of European airports. But a commission spokesman says the Chinese have already taken steps to comply. [Reuters]

headline.main: On Our Radar: A Chinese Challenge on Airline Emissions
